result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deambrece L Hobbs

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deambrece L Hobbs not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Taylor Haefele for  Allison Marie Ritter in court for Deambrece L Hobbs.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense is still in the process of reviewing discovery material and  request an adjournment.=
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deambrece L Hobbs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Deambrece L Hobbs.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Sandoval. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order and No firearm Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: TEH, ADC
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for LEVEL 5 Supervision..

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  .

Defendant Deambrece L Hobbs in court, in custody.  
Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Deambrece L Hobbs.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for return on doctors report. Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  
State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Court  adopts the professional opinion of the examiner's that the defendant does not lack substantial capacity to understand the proceedings or aid in his/her defense. 
Court finds defendant competent and reinstates the proceedings.  Court ordered case for a  Preliminary Hearing in preliminary court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court is in receipt of email from DHS requesting a new date within  14 days.  Parties contacted via email  and new doctor return date selected. 
Doctor's Report Return date scheduled August 30, 2022 at 8:30am.
Report dated 08-24-2022, filed.
Signed and filed. Send to DHS.
Signed and filed.
Amended Proposed Order

Defendant Deambrece L Hobbs not in court.  Attorney Amanda Kremer in court for Allison Ritter. Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties in court for hearing regarding Involuntary Medication Order.   Sworn for the State:  Dr. Elliot Lee.  State rests.  No Cross examination.   Testimony closed.  Statements made by the State, No position by defense.  The Court will order the Involuntary Medication, which is likely to help  restore  competency.   Order signed and filed.  mn
Order for Involuntary Medication and Treatment, signed and filed.
Motion regarding order for involuntary medication scheduled for 6/24/22 at 10 via zoom.  mn
Cover sheet for confidential records, Filed.
971.14(5) request for order to treat, Filed
971.14(5) motion for order to treat, Filed.

Defendant Deambrece L Hobbs in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Deambrece L Hobbs in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video means. Court in reciept of report filed 05/31/2022 by Dr. Jenna Niess. Parties are not objecting to report.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Competency report, Filed.
GF 244, Filed.
Signed and filed.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Deambrece L Hobbs not in court, in custody. Alexandria Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Doctor's Report Return. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings, and ordered defendant examined by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department and the case is adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report on June 2nd at 8:30 am, Branch 40.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deambrece L Hobbs not in court, defendant in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Newly appointed counsel is requesting a short adjournment to review the complaint and dr. report.  Br 45 is down the week of 3/7 and asked the review hearing heard in  Br 40.  mn
received and filed.
Competency eval 971.14(2), filed.
Cover sheet for confidential records, filed.
Signed and filed.
Order for Competency Evaluation

Attorney Colleen Cullen in court as a friend to the court, defendant Deambrece L Hobbs not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties appeared via Zoom. 
Case in court for Doctors Report Return. Defendant has refused to cooperate with Dr. Pankiewicz. Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's department to be transported FORTHWITH to a DHS facility for an inpatient competency evaluation. Case adjounred to Branch 45.  Review hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. HOBBS REFUSAL LTR
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, as a friend of the court, defendant Deambrece L Hobbs not in court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
